intro: Cuminia eriantha, commonly known as mountain cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its seeds, which are used as a spice, have a warm, earthy flavor and are often used in Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cuisines. Cuminia eriantha thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates.
